intro: Gynandriris burchellii, commonly known as the Burchell's starling, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, commonly known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. Its leaves are typically trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Gynandriris burchellii is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
